intro: Senecio thermarum, commonly known as the hot spring senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with narrow, linear leaves that help reduce water loss. Senecio thermarum is often cultivated in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
